UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: QSAR Reveals Decreased Lipophilicity of Polar Residues Determines the Selectivity of Antimicrobial Peptide Activity.
Literature.Author: van der Walt M, Möller DS, van Wyk RJ, Ferguson PM, Hind CK, Clifford M, Do Carmo Silva P, Sutton JM, Mason AJ, Bester MJ, Gaspar ARM

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli NCTC 12923(MIC=>128µg/ml),Escherichia coli LEC001(MIC=>128µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=>128µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa NCTC 13437(MIC=>128µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 17978(MIC=>128µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii AYE(MIC=>128µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae M6(MIC=>128µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae NCTC 13368(MIC=>128µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 9144(MIC=>128µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus NCTC 13616(MIC=>128µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=>128µg/ml),Candida tropicalis NCPF 8760(MIC50=>128µg/ml),Candida krusei NCPF 3876(MIC50=>128µg/ml),Candida glabrata NCPF 8018(MIC50=>128µg/ml),Candida parapsilosis NCPF 3209(MIC50=>128µg/ml),Candida albicans NCPF 3281(MIC50=>128µg/ml),Candida auris TDG 1912(MIC50=>128µg/ml)
